text: Redfield is a city in Bourbon County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 90 people lived there. == History == Redfield was founded in 1866. The city was named for Dr. Redfield, an early settler. The first post office in Redfield was created in 1872. Throughout the 20th century, the town was served by the Missouri Pacific Railroad. == Geography == Redfield is at (37.836556, -94.881987), along the Marmaton River. According to the United States Census Bureau, the city has a total area of . All of it is land. === Climate === Redfield has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. According to the KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Redfield has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Redfield, Kansas == Demographics == === 2020 census === As of the 2020 census, there were 90 people, 39 households, and 25 families living in the city. Of the households, 82.1% owned their home and 17.9% rented their home. The median age was 42.7 years. Of the people, 86.7% were White, 3.3% were Native American, and 10.0% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 1.1% of the people. === 2010 census === As of the 2010 census says that there were 146 people, 53 households, and 33 families living in the city. == Notable people == * Richard Christy, drummer for Death, radio personality, The Howard Stern Show * Elmer McCollum, biochemist, co-discovered Vitamin A == References == == Other websites == ;City * Redfield - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 235, local school district ;Maps * Redfield City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Bourbon County, Kansas Category:1866 establishments in Kansas
title: Redfield, Kansas
